protocol_info.name: BB84 Protocol
protocol_info.description: The first quantum key distribution protocol that enables secure communication using quantum mechanical principles

quantum_principles.no_cloning_theorem: It is impossible to create a perfect copy of an arbitrary unknown quantum state
quantum_principles.measurement_disturbance: Any measurement of a quantum system disturbs the system, making eavesdropping detectable
quantum_principles.quantum_uncertainty: Quantum states cannot be measured in incompatible bases simultaneously

protocol_steps.title: Key Generation
protocol_steps.description: Alice generates two random bit strings: one for the data bits and one for the basis choice
details: Alice creates random bit string (e.g., 0110101...)
Alice creates random basis string (e.g., 0101010...)
0 = rectilinear basis, 1 = diagonal basis

protocol_steps.title: Quantum State Preparation
protocol_steps.description: Alice encodes each bit into photon polarization according to chosen basis
details: Bit 0 in rectilinear → horizontal polarization (0°)
Bit 1 in rectilinear → vertical polarization (90°)
Bit 0 in diagonal → diagonal polarization (45°)
Bit 1 in diagonal → anti-diagonal polarization (-45°)

protocol_steps.title: Quantum Transmission
protocol_steps.description: Alice sends polarized photons to Bob through quantum channel
details: Photons travel through fiber optic cable or free space
Each photon carries one qubit of information
Channel may be insecure but quantum properties provide security

protocol_steps.title: Random Measurement
protocol_steps.description: Bob randomly chooses measurement basis for each received photon
details: Bob generates random basis string independently
Measures each photon in either rectilinear or diagonal basis
Gets correct result only if basis matches Alice's encoding

protocol_steps.title: Basis Reconciliation
protocol_steps.description: Alice and Bob publicly compare basis choices over classical channel
details: Alice announces her basis choice for each bit (not the bit values)
Bob announces his measurement basis choice
They keep only bits where bases match (≈50% of bits)

protocol_steps.title: Error Detection
protocol_steps.description: Test subset of sifted key to detect eavesdropping
details: Randomly select subset of matching bits
Compare bit values publicly
If error rate > 25%, abort protocol (eavesdropper detected)
If error rate ≤ 25%, proceed with key

protocol_steps.title: Error Correction & Privacy Amplification
protocol_steps.description: Correct remaining errors and compress key for final security
details: Apply error correction algorithms
Use privacy amplification to reduce Eve's information
Generate final shared secret key

security_features.eavesdropping_detection: Any measurement by Eve disturbs photon states, introducing detectable errors
security_features.unconditional_security: Security based on laws of physics, not computational assumptions
security_features.information_theoretic_security: Even with unlimited computing power, Eve cannot break the protocol

advantages: Provable security based on quantum physics
limitations: Limited transmission distance (due to photon loss)
Lower key generation rates compared to classical methods
